comments:
NullPointerException is thrown when chaining methods.
This has just started to occur after the latest update.

Sample code:
class Test 
{

}

$test = new Test();
$test->test('test')->test()->test()

Reproducable by clicking on the chain between "->test('test')" and "test()" in chain. 

This is because test() is not defined.

But if you had something like this: 

class Test
{
	function test()
	{
		return new Test();
	}
}

$test = new test();
$test->test()->test()->test();

OR even 


class Test
{
	function test()
	{

	}
}

$test = new test();
$test->test()->test()->test();

It works fine.
